snippet: The World Anti-Doping Agency responded to a documentary shown Sunday that accused a coach of continuing to train athletes while serving a suspension.
abstract: World Anti-Doping Agency cites new allegations against Russia, saying county has long way to go in cleaning up its drug-testing program before its track and field athletes can be reinstated for 2016 Olympic Games.
lead_paragraph: The World Anti-Doping Agency responded to a documentary shown Sunday that accused a coach of continuing to train athletes while serving a suspension.

headline.main: Russia Still Has ‘Much, Much Work’ to Do, WADA Says
